newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Dainong Group's debts exceed assets-creditor bank.
newsitem.headline: Dainong Group's debts exceed assets-creditor bank.

text.p: South Korea's troubled Dainong Group had 1.84 trillion won of debts at the end of 1996, compared to total assets valued at 1.79 trillion won, the group's prime creditor bank said on Monday.

The figures were disclosed when SEOULBANK released a statement officially announcing its decision to bail out four of Dainong's 21 affiliates -- Midopa Department Co, Dainong Corp, Dainong Heavy Industries Inc and Metro Product Co.
The statement said the move was in line with an earlier agreement among financial institutions to prevent promising companies from going bankrupt under financial troubles.
It said failures of Dainong affiliates were feared to result in huge job losses, bad debts at financial institutions, and a string of insolvencies of subcontractors.
The failure of Dainong and Midopa would lead to the loss of about 6,500 jobs and cause the insolvency of about 4,600 subcontractors and related companies, the statement said.
The two core companies accounted for 81 percent of the group's total sales and 72 percent of total assets in 1996, the statement said.
The Korea Stock Exchange suspended trading in shares of Midopa and Dainong Corp from Monday afternoon, citing rumours that they would be designated for bail-out.
